text: Stanley Mandelstam (12 December 1928 - 23 June 2016) was a South African-born American theoretical physicist of Jewish descent.Jewish Year Book 2005, page 214. He introduced the Mandelstam variables into particle physics in 1958. It was a coordinate system for creating his double dispersion relations. He was the Professor of Mathematical Physics at the University of Birmingham (1960-63), the Professeur Associé at Université Paris-Sud (1979–80; 1984–85) and the Professor of Physics at the University of California, Berkeley from 1963 until his death and was also the Professor Emeritus from 1994 until his death. ==References== ==Other websites== * Web page at Berkeley Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:Foreign Members of the Royal Society Category:Jewish American academics Category:Jewish American scientists Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Johannesburg Category:South African Jews Category:American theoretical physicists Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty
